de.ibm.com.opentm2scripteride
Class MainApp

java.lang.Object
  de.ibm.com.opentm2scripteride.MainApp

public class MainApp
extends java.lang.Object

This class cares about opening, saving and parsing of files It also includes the static main method as entry point for the application.

Nested Class Summary
protected  class MainApp.DocumentChangeListener
          A simple DocumentListener that notifies the MainApp if anything in the document was changed

Constructor Detail

MainApp

protected MainApp()
The constructor. Initializes the variables and commissions the EventQueue with creating the MainWindow

Method Detail

documentChanged

public void documentChanged()
If the document has changed this method is called to update all state variables, the window title and starts parsing if it didn't parse so far

getAppName

public java.lang.String getAppName()
Returns the name of the application

Returns:
The name of the application

getInstance

public static MainApp getInstance()
This is the only way to construct and access the MainApp class. It makes sure that only one instance exists and everybody can globally access it

Returns:
The instance of the MainApp object

getMainWindow

public MainWindow getMainWindow()
Returns the main window object

Returns:
The main window

getOpenedFile

public java.io.File getOpenedFile()
Returns the currently opened file

Returns:
The opened file or null if it's a new file

getVersion

public java.lang.String getVersion()
Returns the version of the application

Returns:
The current version as a string

hasUnsavedChanges

public boolean hasUnsavedChanges()
Returns if the editors content is unsaved

Returns:
True if there are unsaved changes, false otherwise

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Entry point for application, simply creates an instance of MainApp

Parameters:
args - The arguments we got from the environment or command line

newFile

public void newFile()
Opens the template file in the editor, so the user can create a new file.

openFile

public boolean openFile(java.io.File file)
Opens of file in the editor

Parameters:
file - The file to be opened
Returns:
True on success, false otherwise

openFileFromConfiguration

protected void openFileFromConfiguration()
Opens the file the user opened in the last session. If the user had no document opened before a new one is opened

reparse

protected void reparse()
Reparses the document. It can be called manually if you have to reparse the editors content NOW. Otherwise a timer calls this functions in regular intervals as soon startParsing() was called

saveFile

public boolean saveFile(java.io.File filename)
Saves the content of the editor to the given filename

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file to write the editor's content in. Note that any existing file will be overwritten
Returns:
True on success, false otherwise

startParsing

public void startParsing()
Starts a timer for permanent parsing of the editors content

updateWindowTitle

protected void updateWindowTitle()
Updates the window title, regarding the state of the document
